frame.name: Commemorative
frame.definition:
<def-root>This frame describes a particular compounding construction (a pattern of coinage) by which more complex words can be created by joining an <fen>Honored_entity</fen> to a <fen>Dedicated_type</fen> to describe a particular <fen>Dedicated_entity</fen> which has been officially named for the <fen>Honored_entity</fen>. The <fen>Dedicated_type</fen> and <fen>Honored_entity</fen> FEs each form part of the Lexical Units (annotated on the second FE layer), and the <fen>Dedicated_entity</fen> is the denotation of the whole. Since each of the FEs is a part of the Lexical Unit, there is no assignment of Grammatical Function or Phrase Type. The <fen>Dedicated_type</fen> should (in principle) also be annotated as a LU in a separate frame. Targets are added opportunistically to this frame in the course of annotating other frames. For example, the Day of <t>Armistice Day</t> should also be annotated in the Calendric_unit frame.
<ex>1st layer: Turn right at the <fex name="ded"><t>Jefferson Building</t></fex>.</ex> <ex>2nd layer: Turn right at the <fex name="Honored_entity">Jefferson</fex> <fex name="Dedicated_type">Building</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Honored_entity
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the person, subject, or event that is being honored.
<ex>We have a picnic every year on <t><fex name="Honored_entity">Veterans'</fex> day</t>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Dedicated_type
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the type of entity that had been dedicated to honor the <fen>Honored_entity</fen>.
<ex>Is <t>Armistice <fex name="Ded_typ">DAY</fex></t> a national holiday?</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Dedicated_entity
FE.definition:
<def-root>The entity which has been dedicated to the <fen>Honored_entity</fen>.
<ex>The <fex name="ded"><t>Jimmy Hoffa Building</t></fex> hasn't opened yet.</ex></def-root>
